intro: Pritchardia viscosa, commonly known as the sticky pisonia, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its clustered, slender leaves and produces small, white flowers that are followed by distinctive, sticky, orange berries. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important part of Hawaii's native flora. However, it is considered endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species.
